title: Pope to be hospitalized for days for lung infection
description: The Vatican said Pope Francis did not have Covid-19, but that a respiratory infection required Francis to stay in hospital for 'some days of medical therapy'.

title: In Russia, a broken family is just one of the victims of Moscow's increasingly harsh anti-war punishments
description: The father of young Maria, who had expressed her opposition to the 'special operation' in Ukraine through a drawing, fled just before he was sentenced. A court has yet to rule on the fate of the teenager.

title: Long Paris garbage strike ends, workers face daunting cleanup
description: Trash mounds reached up to 10,000 tons along the French capital’s streets, matching the weight of the Eiffel Tower.

title: Senate votes to repeal 2002 measure that approved Iraq war
description: Senators voted 66-30 to repeal the 2002 measure that greenlighted the US' invasion of Iraq in 2003. The measure ends more than 20 years of authorization for US presidents to use force in that country and return those war powers to Congress.

title: Russia threatens retaliation against Armenia over move to ratify Rome Statute
description: The small Caucasian country, an ally of Moscow, has paved the way for ratifying the International Criminal Court's founding treaty. Armenia's move is directed against Azerbaijan and not against Vladimir Putin, who is the target of an ICC arrest warrant.

title: On 'Did You know That There's a Tunnel Under Ocean Blvd', Lana Del Rey dives deep
description: On her ninth studio album, the American singer successfully tries out new musical registers.

title: UN countries call for 'urgent action to save the planet'
description: Scientists say both extreme weather and sea levels have worsened because of climate change caused by the burning of fossil fuels.

title: Paris suburb introduces menstrual leave for female municipal employees, a first in France
description: As of Monday, March 27, female staff in the northern Paris suburb of Saint-Ouen will have the right to take two days paid leave per month if they suffer from painful periods, providing they prove medical justification.

title: The French government's plan to house migrants across country, not just Paris
description: 'Le Monde' has seen a government document saying that migrants will be encouraged to move outside Paris, where they will be guaranteed accommodation and better access to legal services.

title: France's Constitutional Council to rule on Macron pension reform on April 14
description: This ruling follows two no-confidence motions in Macron's government after it forced through the pension reform using Article 49.3 instead of going through a vote.

title: 'Succession': Business as usual for the Roys
description: 'Succession' final season (1/10). Every week, 'Le Monde' reviews the trials and tribulations of the Roy family and its media empire.

title: French pension reform: PM looks for talks with unions, new national protest date set
description: After failing to find common ground, French Prime Minister Elisabeth borne has invited unions to meet next week. Union leader Laurent Berger wants a mediator to be named to help 'find a way out'.

title: The EU must prioritize decarbonized energy
description: By committing itself to open the way to synthetic fuels for the automotive industry to satisfy German demands, Brussels is headed for a dead end, though there is an urgent need to optimize a resource that should be considered a common good.

title: Paris Opera's 2023-2024 season: Revivals, classics and rare gems are all on the menu
description: Twenty operas and 13 dance shows are on the program which features a 'mixture of caution and curiosity,' according to director Alexander Neef.

title: French prosecutors investigate case of man severely wounded at water reservoir protest
description: A 32-year-old has been in a coma since Saturday following a protest against a water reservoir for farm irrigation under construction in western France that led to violent clashes with the police.

title: American Jews rally in historic numbers against Israel's judicial overhaul
description: The reform, which was called to a halt by PM Benjamin Netanyahu after unprecedented protests in Israel, generated an important backlash in the American diaspora.

title: Given the high level of violence at French 'megabasin' protest, it's time for questions
description: After protests against the construction of a giant reservoir in western France left hundreds injured, the organizing groups are questioning the forms of action used.

title: Recording proves emergency services were barred access by police at violent reservoir protest
description: The Human Rights League was told that police had barred emergency services' access to a protest on Saturday against the construction of a huge water reservoir in western France, where people were injured. 'Le Monde' was able to listen to a recorded phone conversation establishing the facts.

title: French lawmakers recognize Ukraine's Soviet-era famine as 'genocide'
description: A 1932-1933 famine known in Ukraine as 'Holodomor' is regarded by Kyiv as a deliberate act of genocide by Stalin's regime.

title: Germany raises the Union Jack for King Charles III's first official state visit
description: After the French government was forced to postpone his first overseas trip due to protest movements in the country, the new king will arrive for a three day visit to Germany on Wednesday.

title: 'Xi intends to rely on the Global South to bypass a hostile North and establish China as an indispensable power'
description: The Chinese leader is beginning his new term by prioritizing his country's role on the international scene and highlighting his model in the face of the declining role of the West

title: Ukraine stocks up on weapons to prepare for new counter-offensive
description: This week, Kyiv received 18 Leopard 2 tanks from Germany. Ukraine is training troops and collecting intelligence for a new offensive.

title: French government plans to raise minimum age to 14 for electric scooters
description: The new age limit comes days before a referendum in Paris on whether to ban them outright.

title: The pension crisis signals the end of 'original Macronism'
description: Some of the French president's voters are beginning to doubt his ability to emerge from the current situation. They lament the disappearance of the Macron of 2017, and his reformist spirit and ability to overcome divisions.

title: Court backs victim's family in Adnan Syed's 'Serial' case
description: An appellate court ruled that a lower court failed to give sufficient notice to the victim’s family when it scheduled the hearing that vacated Syed’s murder conviction and allowed him to regain his freedom after more than two decades behind bars.

title: Assemblée Nationale passes Olympic Games bill, despite criticism of its security component
description: The political left and human rights organizations have denounced this experiment with intelligent video surveillance, considered 'a step before the implementation of facial recognition.'

title: In Japan, abandoned buildings are on the rise
description: Throughout Japan, 14% of residential buildings are in serious disrepair. The phenomenon is especially stark in Tokyo and Kyoto, where people are trying to save culturally significant buildings that are at risk of being destroyed.

title: New Caledonia's pro-independence movement open to discussions on self-determination with French government
description: Meetings between the French State and the two camps – loyalist and pro-independence – are scheduled to take place in Paris from April 7 to 14.

title: California passes bill that caps oil industry profits
description: The law signed by California Governor Gavin Newsom gives regulators the power to penalize oil companies for making too much money, the first of its kind in the country.

title: The struggles of China's youth in a post pandemic economy
description: The three years of the ultra-strict zero Covid policy are over, but China's youth are now faced with high unemployment rates and wage cuts.

title: Herve Renard resigns as Saudi Arabia coach, expected to take over France women's team
description: The two-time Africa Cup of Nations winner has been touted as favourite to succeed Corinne Diacre before this year's Women's World Cup in Australia and New Zealand.

title: French pension reform protests persist with smaller turnout but an increasing youth presence
description: For the 10th day of national protest, the Ministry of the Interior counted 740,000 demonstrators, compared to 1.1 million on March 23.
